messages.title: A RECOVERING ECONOMY
messages.content: Every vote on 7th May not cast for Alok Sharma, the Conservative Parliamentary Candidate in Reading West, makes it more likely that Reading West will have a Labour MP and Ed Miliband will be Prime Minister.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The leaflet claims Conservatives have helped to repair government finances, cut Labour's record deficit in half, and helped to create over 2 million jobs across the country.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Strategic voting considerations suggest preventing a Labour MP and Ed Miliband from becoming Prime Minister with the support of Nicola Sturgeon and the Scottish National Party.

issues.economy: Conservatives in government have repaired government finances, cut Labour's record deficit in half, and helped to create over 2 million jobs.
issues.socialWelfare: The leaflet mentions higher borrowing, higher taxes, higher welfare bills, and weaker defenses as negative outcomes associated with the Labour party.

quotes.text: I'm offering to make Ed Miliband Prime Minister.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet conveys a message against a potential Miliband-SNP Coalition of Chaos, which it claims would undo the work done by the Conservatives by implementing higher borrowing, taxes, welfare bills, and weak defenses.
